     3â†’ *
     4â†’ * This module provides type-safe access to all content files.
     5â†’ * YAML files are loaded via @rollup/plugin-yaml.
     6â†’ * Case studies are loaded from markdown files with YAML frontmatter.
     7â†’ */
     8â†’
     9â†’import { z } from 'zod';
    10â†’import YAML from 'yaml';
    11â†’import type { PortfolioContent, CaseStudy } from '../types/portfolio';
    12â†’import {
    13â†’  ProfileSchema,
    14â†’  ExperienceSchema,

    16â†’  CertificationsSchema,

    28â†’import certificationsYaml from '../../content/certifications/index.yaml';
    29â†’import skillsYaml from '../../content/skills/index.yaml';
    30â†’import socialYaml from '../../content/social/index.yaml';
    31â†’import passionProjectsYaml from '../../content/passion-projects/index.yaml';
    32â†’
    33â†’// Auto-discover case studies using import.meta.glob (now markdown files)
    34â†’const caseStudyFiles = import.meta.glob('../../content/case-studies/*.md', { query: '?raw', eager: true });
    35â†’
    36â†’// Re-export schemas for backward compatibility
    37â†’export {
    38â†’  ProfileSchema,
    39â†’  ExperienceSchema,
    40â†’  TestimonialsSchema,
    41â†’  CertificationsSchema,
    42â†’  SkillsSchema,
    43â†’  SocialSchema,
    44â†’  CaseStudySchema,
    45â†’  PassionProjectsSchema,
    46â†’  BlogPostSchema
    47â†’};
    48â†’
    49â†’// ------------------------------------------------------------------
    50â†’// Frontmatter Parsing
    51â†’// ------------------------------------------------------------------
    52â†’
    53â†’function parseFrontmatter(raw: string): { frontmatter: Record<string, unknown>; content: string } {
    54â†’  const match = raw.match(/^---\n([\s\S]*?)\n---\n([\s\S]*)$/);
    55â†’  if (!match) return { frontmatter: {}, content: raw };
    56â†’
    57â†’  const frontmatterStr = match[1];
    58â†’  const content = match[2].trim();
    59â†’
    60â†’  try {
    61â†’    const frontmatter = YAML.parse(frontmatterStr);
    62â†’    return { frontmatter, content };
    63â†’  } catch (error) {
    64â†’    console.error('Failed to parse frontmatter:', error);
    65â†’    return { frontmatter: {}, content: raw };
    66â†’  }
    67â†’}
    68â†’
    69â†’// ------------------------------------------------------------------
    70â†’// Runtime Validation
    71â†’// ------------------------------------------------------------------
    72â†’
    73â†’function validate<T>(schema: z.ZodSchema<T>, data: unknown, filename: string): T {
    74â†’  try {
    75â†’    return schema.parse(data);
    76â†’  } catch (error) {
    77â†’    if (error instanceof z.ZodError) {
    78â†’      console.error(`âŒ Validation failed for ${filename}:`, error.flatten().fieldErrors);
    79â†’      throw new Error(`Invalid content in ${filename}: ${error.message}`);
    80â†’    }
    81â†’    throw error;
    82â†’  }
    83â†’}
    84â†’
    85â†’// Export validated content
    86â†’export const profile = validate(ProfileSchema, profileYaml, 'profile.yaml');
    87â†’export const experience = validate(ExperienceSchema, experienceYaml, 'experience/index.yaml');
    88â†’export const testimonials = validate(TestimonialsSchema, testimonialsYaml, 'testimonials/index.yaml');
    89â†’export const certifications = validate(CertificationsSchema, certificationsYaml, 'certifications/index.yaml');
    90â†’export const skills = validate(SkillsSchema, skillsYaml, 'skills/index.yaml');
    91â†’export const social = validate(SocialSchema, socialYaml, 'social/index.yaml');
    92â†’export const passionProjectsData = validate(PassionProjectsSchema, passionProjectsYaml, 'passion-projects/index.yaml');
    93â†’export const passionProjects = passionProjectsData.projects;
    94â†’
    95â†’// Parse and validate case studies from markdown files
    96â†’function parseCaseStudies(): CaseStudy[] {
    97â†’  return Object.entries(caseStudyFiles)
    98â†’    .map(([path, module]) => {
    99â†’      const filename = path.split('/').pop() || 'unknown';
   100â†’      const raw = (module as { default: string }).default;
   101â†’      const { frontmatter, content } = parseFrontmatter(raw);
   102â†’      
   103â†’      // Combine frontmatter with content
   104â†’      const caseStudyData = {
   105â†’        ...frontmatter,
   106â†’        content
   107â†’      };
   108â†’      
   109â†’      return validate(CaseStudySchema, caseStudyData, filename);
   110â†’    })
   111â†’    .sort((a, b) => a.id - b.id);
   112â†’}
   113â†’
   114â†’export const caseStudies = parseCaseStudies();
   115â†’
   116â†’// Aggregated content export
   117â†’export const content: PortfolioContent = {
   118â†’  profile,
   119â†’  experience,
   120â†’  testimonials,
   121â†’  certifications,
   122â†’  skills,
   123â†’  social,
   124â†’  caseStudies,
   125â†’  passionProjects,
   126â†’};
   127â†’
   128â†’// Helper functions
   129â†’export function getCaseStudyBySlug(slug: string) {
   130â†’  return caseStudies.find(cs => cs.slug === slug);
   131â†’}
   132â†’
   133â†’export function getCaseStudyById(id: number) {
   134â†’  return caseStudies.find(cs => cs.id === id);
   135â†’}
   136â†’
   137â†’export function getFeaturedTestimonials() {
   138â†’  return testimonials.testimonials.filter(t => t.featured);
   139â†’}
   140â†’
   141â†’export function getFeaturedCertifications() {

   143â†’}
   144â†’
   145â†’export function getPrimarySocialLinks() {

   147â†’}
   148â†’

   281â†’
   282â†’**High-confidence personal testimonial signals**:
   283â†’```
   284â†’âœ… Contains person's name + positive verb: "[Name] led", "[Name] designed"
   285â†’âœ… Uses "I" + relationship: "I worked with", "I hired", "I managed"

<tool-use data-tool-type="read" data-tool-name="Read"><details>
<summary>Tool use: **Read**</summary>
 `./docs/guides/universal-cv.md`
```
     1â†’# Universal CV System - Complete Guide
     2â†’
     3â†’## Overview
     4â†’
     5â†’The Universal CV system allows you to create personalized portfolio variants tailored to specific job applications. Each variant customizes your hero section, bio, stats, and content emphasis while maintaining factual accuracy.
     6â†’
     7â†’## Live Examples
     8â†’
     9â†’- **Base Portfolio**: `https://edgeoftrust.com/#/`
    10â†’- **Bloomberg (TPM)**: `https://edgeoftrust.com/#/bloomberg/technical-product-manager`
    11â†’- **Gensyn (TPM)**: `https://edgeoftrust.com/#/gensyn/technical-product-manager`
    12â†’
    13â†’---
    14â†’
    15â†’## Architecture
    16â†’
    17â†’### URL Structure
    18â†’```
    19â†’/#/:company/:role
    20â†’```
    21â†’
    22â†’Examples:
    23â†’- `/#/bloomberg/technical-product-manager`
    24â†’- `/#/stripe/senior-pm`
    25â†’- `/#/databricks/ml-platform-lead`
    26â†’
    27â†’### Data Flow
    28â†’
    29â†’```
    30â†’1. User visits /#/bloomberg/technical-product-manager
    31â†’2. React Router captures params: { company: "bloomberg", role: "technical-product-manager" }
    32â†’3. VariantPortfolio loads variant JSON: bloomberg-technical-product-manager.json
    33â†’4. mergeProfile() combines base profile + variant overrides
    34â†’5. VariantContext provides merged profile to Portfolio component
    35â†’6. Sections render personalized content
    36â†’```
    37â†’
    38â†’### File Structure
    39â†’
    40â†’```
    41â†’content/variants/
    42â†’â”œâ”€â”€ README.md                                    # Variant documentation
    43â†’â”œâ”€â”€ _template.yaml                               # Template for new variants
    44â†’â”œâ”€â”€ bloomberg-technical-product-manager.yaml     # Human-readable source
    45â†’â”œâ”€â”€ bloomberg-technical-product-manager.json     # Client-side loading
    46â†’â”œâ”€â”€ gensyn-technical-product-manager.yaml
    47â†’â””â”€â”€ gensyn-technical-product-manager.json
    48â†’```
    49â†’
    50â†’---
    51â†’
    52â†’## Creating a New Variant
    53â†’
    54â†’### Method 1: CLI Generator (Recommended)
    55â†’
    56â†’```bash
    57â†’# Set API key
    58â†’export GEMINI_API_KEY=your_key_here
    59â†’
    60â†’# Generate variant
    61â†’npm run generate:cv -- \
    62â†’  --company "Stripe" \
    63â†’  --role "Senior PM" \
    64â†’  --jd "./stripe-jd.txt" \
    65â†’  --provider gemini
    66â†’
    67â†’# Or inline job description
    68â†’npm run generate:cv -- \
    69â†’  --company "Databricks" \
    70â†’  --role "ML Platform Lead" \
    71â†’  --jd-text "Job description here..." \
    72â†’  --provider gemini
    73â†’```
    74â†’
    75â†’**CLI Options:**
    76â†’- `--company <name>` - Company name (required)
    77â†’- `--role <title>` - Role title (required)
    78â†’- `--jd <file>` - Path to job description file
    79â†’- `--jd-text <text>` - Job description as inline text
    80â†’- `--values <text>` - Company values (optional)
    81â†’- `--context <text>` - Additional context (optional)
    82â†’- `--provider <name>` - AI provider: `claude` | `openai` | `gemini` (default: claude)
    83â†’- `--api-key <key>` - API key (or use env var)
    84â†’- `--output <file>` - Output file path (auto-generated if not specified)
    85â†’
    86â†’**Supported AI Providers:**
    87â†’- **Claude** (Anthropic): `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY`
    88â†’- **OpenAI**: `OPENAI_API_KEY`
    89â†’- **Gemini** (Google): `GEMINI_API_KEY`
    90â†’
    91â†’### Method 2: Manual Creation
    92â†’
    93â†’1. **Copy template:**
    94â†’   ```bash
    95â†’   cp content/variants/_template.yaml content/variants/company-role.yaml
    96â†’   ```
    97â†’
    98â†’2. **Edit YAML file** with variant overrides
    99â†’
   100â†’3. **Generate JSON:**
   101â†’   ```bash
   102â†’   npx tsx -e "
   103â†’   import { readFileSync, writeFileSync } from 'fs';
   104â†’   import YAML from 'yaml';
   105â†’   const yaml = readFileSync('content/variants/company-role.yaml', 'utf-8');
   106â†’   writeFileSync('content/variants/company-role.json', JSON.stringify(YAML.parse(yaml), null, 2));
   107â†’   "
   108â†’   ```
   109â†’
   110â†’4. **Validate:**
   111â†’   ```bash
   112â†’   npm run validate
   113â†’   ```
   114â†’
   115â†’---
   116â†’
   117â†’## Variant Schema
   118â†’
   119â†’### Metadata
   120â†’
   121â†’```yaml
   122â†’metadata:
   123â†’  company: "Bloomberg"                          # Company name
   124â†’  role: "Technical Product Manager"            # Role title
   125â†’  slug: "bloomberg-technical-product-manager"  # URL slug (lowercase-hyphenated)
   126â†’  generatedAt: "2025-12-16T18:30:00Z"          # ISO timestamp
   127â†’  jobDescription: |                            # Full job description
   128â†’    Job requirements here...
   129â†’  generationModel: "claude-3-5-sonnet"         # AI model used
   130â†’```
   131â†’
   132â†’### Overrides
   133â†’
   134â†’Override specific profile fields for personalization:
   135â†’
   136â†’```yaml
   137â†’overrides:
   138â†’  hero:
   139â†’    status: "Open to Technical PM roles â€” Platform Architecture, Developer Tools"
   140â†’    headline:
   141â†’      - text: "Building"
   142â†’        style: "italic"
   143â†’      - text: "developer platforms at the intersection of"
   144â†’        style: "muted"
   145â†’      - text: "scale and innovation"
   146â†’        style: "accent"
   147â†’    subheadline: >
   148â†’      Personalized elevator pitch emphasizing relevant experience
   149â†’
   150â†’  about:
   151â†’    tagline: >
   152â†’      Professional summary highlighting job fit
   153â†’    bio:
   154â†’      - "First paragraph: current role and relevant experience..."
   155â†’      - "Second paragraph: career journey leading to this role..."
   156â†’    stats:
   157â†’      - value: "8+"
   158â†’        label: "Years Platform PM"
   159â†’      - value: "7+"
   160â†’        label: "SDK/API Products"
   161â†’
   162â†’  sections:
   163â†’    beyondWork: false      # Show/hide sections based on job relevance
   164â†’    blog: true
   165â†’    onchainIdentity: false
   166â†’    skills: true
   167â†’    passionProjects: true
   168â†’```
   169â†’
   170â†’### Relevance Scoring
   171â†’
   172â†’AI ranks your existing content by relevance (0.0-1.0):
   173â†’
   174â†’```yaml
   175â†’relevance:
   176â†’  caseStudies:
   177â†’    - slug: "developer-analytics"
   178â†’      relevanceScore: 0.95
   179â†’      reasoning: "Direct SDK/platform architecture experience"
   180â†’    - slug: "ankr-rpc"
   181â†’      relevanceScore: 0.90
   182â†’      reasoning: "API platform growth demonstrates stakeholder management"
   183â†’
   184â†’  skills:
   185â†’    - category: "Technical Leadership"
   186â†’      relevanceScore: 1.0
   187â†’    - category: "Product Strategy"
   188â†’      relevanceScore: 0.95
   189â†’
   190â†’  projects:
   191â†’    - slug: "ai-agent-framework"
   192â†’      relevanceScore: 0.85
   193â†’      reasoning: "Demonstrates ML infrastructure experience"
   194â†’```
   195â†’
   196â†’---
   197â†’
   198â†’## Personalization Strategy
   199â†’
   200â†’### What Gets Personalized
   201â†’
   202â†’âœ… **Hero Section**
   203â†’- Status line (role type emphasis)
   204â†’- Headline (key value proposition)
   205â†’- Subheadline (tailored elevator pitch)
   206â†’
   207â†’âœ… **About Section**
   208â†’- Tagline (professional summary)
   209â†’- Bio paragraphs (career narrative)
   210â†’- Stats (metrics that matter for role)
   211â†’
   212â†’âœ… **Section Visibility**
   213â†’- Show/hide sections based on job fit
   214â†’- Example: Show onchain identity for Web3 roles, hide for traditional tech
   215â†’
   216â†’âœ… **Content Ordering**
   217â†’- Case studies ranked by relevance
   218â†’- Skills emphasized by category
   219â†’- Projects highlighted by fit
   220â†’
   221â†’### What Stays Consistent
   222â†’
   223â†’âŒ **Factual Content**
   224â†’- Case study text unchanged
   225â†’- Experience details unchanged
   226â†’- All achievements remain truthful
   227â†’
   228â†’âŒ **Design & Brand**
   229â†’- Same visual design system
   230â†’- Same navigation and UX
   231â†’- Same color scheme and typography
   232â†’
   233â†’---
   234â†’
   235â†’## Best Practices
   236â†’
   237â†’### 1. Gather Comprehensive Info
   238â†’
   239â†’Before generating:
   240â†’- Full job description
   241â†’- Company values/culture research
   242â†’- Specific technologies mentioned
   243â†’- Role emphasis (technical vs. strategic vs. people leadership)
   244â†’
   245â†’### 2. Review & Refine
   246â†’
   247â†’After generation:
   248â†’- Review hero headline for impact
   249â†’- Ensure bio flows naturally
   250â†’- Verify stats are relevant
   251â†’- Check section visibility makes sense
   252â†’
   253â†’### 3. Test Before Sharing
   254â†’
   255â†’```bash
   256â†’# Local testing
   257â†’npm run dev
   258â†’# Visit: http://localhost:5173/#/company/role
   259â†’
   260â†’# Validate content
   261â†’npm run validate
   262â†’
   263â†’# Build for production
   264â†’npm run build
   265â†’```
   266â†’
   267â†’### 4. Naming Conventions
   268â†’
   269â†’**Slugs:** Use lowercase with hyphens
   270â†’- âœ… `bloomberg-technical-product-manager`
   271â†’- âŒ `Bloomberg_Technical_Product_Manager`
   272â†’
   273â†’**Files:** Match slug exactly
   274â†’- `{slug}.yaml` - Human-readable source
   275â†’- `{slug}.json` - Client-side loading
   276â†’
   277â†’---
   278â†’
   279â†’## Editing Existing Variants
   280â†’
   281â†’### Update YAML Source
   282â†’
   283â†’```bash
   284â†’# Edit the human-readable YAML
   285â†’vim content/variants/bloomberg-technical-product-manager.yaml
   286â†’
   287â†’# Regenerate JSON
   288â†’npx tsx -e "
   289â†’import { readFileSync, writeFileSync } from 'fs';
   290â†’import YAML from 'yaml';
   291â†’const yaml = readFileSync('content/variants/bloomberg-technical-product-manager.yaml', 'utf-8');
   292â†’writeFileSync('content/variants/bloomberg-technical-product-manager.json',
   293â†’  JSON.stringify(YAML.parse(yaml), null, 2));
   294â†’"
   295â†’
   296â†’# Validate
   297â†’npm run validate
   298â†’
   299â†’# Test
   300â†’npm run dev
   301â†’```

   305â†’## Deployment
   306â†’
   307â†’### GitHub Pages (Current Setup)
   308â†’
   309â†’Using HashRouter for client-side routing:
   310â†’
   311â†’```bash
   312â†’# Merge PR
   313â†’git checkout main
   314â†’git pull origin main
   315â†’
   316â†’# GitHub Pages auto-deploys
   317â†’
   318â†’# Test live URLs
   319â†’https://edgeoftrust.com/#/bloomberg/technical-product-manager
   320â†’https://edgeoftrust.com/#/gensyn/technical-product-manager
   321â†’```
   322â†’
   323â†’### Alternative Hosting
   324â†’
   325â†’For **Vercel/Netlify** (clean URLs without hash):
   326â†’
   327â†’1. Switch back to BrowserRouter in `src/App.tsx`
   328â†’2. Add rewrites config (see section below)
   329â†’3. Deploy
   330â†’
   331â†’**Vercel** (`vercel.json`):
   332â†’```json
   333â†’{
   334â†’  "rewrites": [
   335â†’    { "source": "/(.*)", "destination": "/index.html" }
   336â†’  ]
   337â†’}
   338â†’```
   339â†’
   340â†’**Netlify** (`netlify.toml`):
   341â†’```toml
   342â†’[[redirects]]
   343â†’  from = "/*"
   344â†’  to = "/index.html"
   345â†’  status = 200
   346â†’```
   347â†’

   349â†’
   350â†’## Troubleshooting
   351â†’
   352â†’### Variant Not Loading
   353â†’
   354â†’**Issue:** Variant URL shows base portfolio
   355â†’
   356â†’**Checks:**
   357â†’1. âœ… JSON file exists: `content/variants/{slug}.json`
   358â†’2. âœ… Slug matches URL: `/#/company/role` â†’ `company-role.json`
   359â†’3. âœ… File validates: `npm run validate`
   360â†’4. âœ… Build includes variant: Check `dist/assets/` for variant chunk
   361â†’
   362â†’**Debug:**
   363â†’```bash
   364â†’# Check if variant file exists
   365â†’ls -la content/variants/
   366â†’
   367â†’# Validate schema
   368â†’npm run validate
   369â†’
   370â†’# Check build output
   371â†’npm run build | grep "technical-product-manager"
   372â†’
   373â†’# Test locally
   374â†’npm run dev
   375â†’# Open browser console at /#/company/role
   376â†’```
   377â†’
   378â†’### Sections Not Personalizing
   379â†’
   380â†’**Issue:** Hero/About look the same as base
   381â†’
   382â†’**Fix:** Ensure sections receive profile prop (fixed in latest version)
   383â†’
   384â†’**Verify:**
   385â†’```tsx
   386â†’// src/components/Portfolio.tsx
   387â†’<HeroSection profile={profile} ... />  // âœ… Has profile prop
   388â†’<HeroSection ... />  // âŒ Missing profile prop
   389â†’```
   390â†’
   391â†’### 404 on Variant URLs
   392â†’
   393â†’**Issue:** URLs return 404
   394â†’
   395â†’**Fix:** Using HashRouter for GitHub Pages
   396â†’- URLs must include `#`: `/#/company/role`
   397â†’- Not: `/company/role` (clean URLs need server config)
   398â†’

   453â†’---
   454â†’
   455â†’## API Reference
   456â†’
   457â†’### loadVariant(slug: string)
   458â†’
   459â†’Loads and validates a variant JSON file.
   460â†’
   461â†’```typescript
   462â†’import { loadVariant } from '../lib/variants';
   463â†’
   464â†’const variant = await loadVariant('bloomberg-technical-product-manager');
   465â†’// Returns: Variant | null
   466â†’```
   467â†’
   468â†’### mergeProfile(variant: Variant)
   469â†’
   470â†’Merges base profile with variant overrides.
   471â†’
   472â†’```typescript
   473â†’import { mergeProfile } from '../lib/variants';
   474â†’
   475â†’const mergedProfile = mergeProfile(variant);
   476â†’// Returns: MergedProfile (Profile with overrides applied)
   477â†’```
   478â†’
   479â†’### VariantContext
   480â†’
   481â†’Provides active profile to components.
   482â†’
   483â†’```typescript
   484â†’import { useVariant } from '../context/VariantContext';
   485â†’
   486â†’function MyComponent() {
   487â†’  const { profile, variant, isVariant } = useVariant();
   488â†’  // profile: Active profile (base or merged)
   489â†’  // variant: Variant data if active, null otherwise
   490â†’  // isVariant: Boolean flag
   491â†’}
   492â†’```
   493â†’

```md
# CV Data Ingestion Guide

## Overview

The `cv-data-ingestion` skill transforms unstructured career data (Obsidian notes, CSVs, zip archives, resumes) into the portfolio's validated content structure.

**Location**: `.claude/skills/cv-data-ingestion/SKILL.md`

---

## Quick Reference

### When to Use

- Importing career data from Obsidian vaults
- Processing LinkedIn exports
- Enriching experience entries with metrics
- Mining case study material from project docs
- Extracting testimonials from reviews/recommendations

### Key Improvements (v2 - Dec 2025)

| Feature | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| **Schema-First** | Always read `src/lib/schemas.ts` before writing ANY content |
| **Pre-Validation** | Validate structure in memory before file writes |
| **AI Summary Detection** | Use existing AI summaries as primary source |
| **Confidence Scoring** | Flag uncertain extractions for user review |
| **Link Extraction** | Extract company URLs for verification |
| **Testimonial Heuristics** | Distinguish personal vs project quotes |

---

## Critical Schema Constraints

**Read these BEFORE writing content files:**

### Skills (Most Common Error)

\```yaml
# WRONG - Will fail validation
skills:
  - name: "Ethereum"
    level: "expert"

# CORRECT - Simple strings only
skills:
  - "Ethereum"
  - "Staking Infrastructure"
\```

### Case Study Media Types

Only these values are allowed:
\```
blog | twitter | linkedin | video | article | slides
\```

### Experience Highlights

\```yaml
# WRONG - Objects
highlights:
  - achievement: "Grew revenue"
    metric: "15x"

# CORRECT - Simple strings
highlights:
  - "Grew revenue 15x through API monetization"
\```

---

## Workflow Phases

### Phase 0: Schema Understanding (MANDATORY)

\```bash
# ALWAYS start by reading the schema
Read src/lib/schemas.ts
\```

### Phase 1: Data Discovery

1. **Check for AI summaries first** (Gemini reviews, Claude outputs)
2. Inventory source files with confidence scores
3. Prioritize structured sources over raw notes

### Phase 2: Experience Enrichment

- Extract company URLs (e.g., `mempools.com`)
- Use 5-7 highlights per role (not 3)
- Flag low-confidence metrics with `[VERIFY]`

### Phase 3: Case Study Mining

- Look for problem â†’ approach â†’ result arcs
- Verify media type enum values before writing
- Include quantifiable metrics

### Phase 4: Testimonial Extraction

**Personal testimonials** (USE):
- "Working with [Name]..."
- "I recommend..."
- Contains personal qualities

**Project quotes** (DO NOT USE as testimonials):
- "The project delivered..."
- "The team achieved..."

### Phase 5: Skills Taxonomy

- Use simple strings (schema limitation)
- Preserve evidence in YAML comments
- Categories: Technical, Domain, Leadership, etc.

### Phase 6: Validation

\```bash
npm run validate
\```

---

## Confidence Scoring System

| Level | Criteria | Action |
|-------|----------|--------|
| **High** | Exact quote, verified metric | Use directly |
| **Medium** | Synthesized, approximated | Use with note |
| **Low** | Inferred, placeholder `[X%]` | Flag for review |

---

## Link Extraction

Always extract company URLs for verification:

| Company Type | URL Priority |
|-------------|--------------|
| Active startup | Official website |
| Enterprise | Careers/about page |
| Acquired | Parent company or press |
| Defunct | LinkedIn or archive.org |

---

## Common Errors & Fixes

| Error | Cause | Fix |
|-------|-------|-----|
| `Cannot read 'map'` | Object instead of string array | Use simple strings |
| `Invalid enum value` | Wrong media type | Use allowed types only |
| `Required field missing` | Forgot `featured` on testimonial | Add `featured: true/false` |

---

## Output Files

| Content Type | Target Path |
|-------------|-------------|
| Experience | `content/experience/index.yaml` |
| Skills | `content/skills/index.yaml` |
| Testimonials | `content/testimonials/index.yaml` |
| Case Studies | `content/case-studies/NN-slug.md` |
| Gap Analysis | `docs/gap-analysis.md` |

---

## Related Documentation

- **Full Skill Definition**: `.claude/skills/cv-data-ingestion/SKILL.md`
- **Templates**: `.claude/skills/cv-data-ingestion/TEMPLATES.md`
- **Process Log**: `docs/data-ingestion-process-log.md`
- **Gap Analysis**: `docs/gap-analysis.md`
- **Content Schema**: `src/lib/schemas.ts`

---

## Invoking the Skill

\```
/cv-data-ingestion
\```

Or describe your data source:
> "I have an Obsidian vault at ~/Career-Notes with my work history"

```
```
File created successfully at: /Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/docs/guides/cv-data-ingestion.md
```
